headline: Creamy Garlic Pasta
description: Looking for creamy pasta recipes? Look no further. This is the best, with garlic, cream, and Parmesan cheese ‚Äî a dish that is easy and delicious.

video.description: Best garlic pasta I have ever had. Add prawns and/or scallops to make an amazing seafood Alfredo.
video.name: How to Make Creamy Garlic Pasta

name: Creamy Garlic Pasta
recipeIngredient: 3 cups chicken broth, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add butter and stir constantly until melted. Pour in 3 cups chicken broth; add pepper and salt. Bring to a boil.
Add spaghetti and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Add more chicken broth if pasta starts to stick to the pan.
Add Parmesan cheese, cream, and parsley and mix until thoroughly combined. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I used a vegetarian broth, used half & half instead of cream, no butter, and added shrimp. Fewer calories and still very tasty. Love it!

I made this tonight and it was a hit. I added spicy Italian sausage by slicing and cooking it first, removing it from the pan, and adding the garlic to the drippings. Definitely one I will make again.

I loved this! I did make 2 changes, I didn't realize I had no heavy cream, so I substituted 2 oz of cream cheese; also at the very end I added a jar of thin shaved truffle slices I should have totally taken a picture but it was all gone before I thought to grab my phone. SCRUMP-DELI-ICIOUS! Gonna make it again SooN!
Very good, Made it with Chicken Parmesan

I LOVE this recipe. I did make a couple of changes, however. I cook a couple of strips of bacon in the pot, then saut√© the garlic in the bacon grease with the juice from one lemon, omitting the olive oil and butter. I also use a whole box (1 lb) instead of 1/2 a lb. I found that this gives a better consistency and gives my family of four enough for leftovers. I often serve it with roasted vegetables. This is a staple in our house‚Äîmy picky eaters love it!

I made this, this evening and it was a HUGE hit with my picky-eating peeps! I added a few seasonings and seasoned chicken on fettuccine noodles instead of spaghetti and served with Garlic sticks! We loved it! Was easy and fast! Will Dede be making this often! Thanks for sharing!
So good! Even my picky eaters love it. I have now made this several times. Its a staple in our house.

Veganised this with vegan broth, dairy free cream and dairy free Parmesan! I am a cheese lover but would halve the Parmesan then add more as necessary or it‚Äôs a lot. If you‚Äôre not adding protein or veg to this meal this portion serves 2. I love this recipe
It was awsome!
greatest in the world

I love this recipe, and have made it many times, but I don't add that much parmesan. Sometimes I'll make and eat as written, sometimes I add leftover chicken, or sometimes I'll saute some green peppers & onions, add some black pepper to it to make it a little spicy. Quick, easy, very versatile and simple.
Very flavorful! I added spinach, onions and mushrooms‚Ä¶ it was an absolute hit with the kids!
I'm sure I did something wrong because mine was very runny--you didn't drain the pasta before adding the cheese and cream?
Love so good and so easy I used Vegetable Broth.

I really liked this pasta. Made half the recipe for two and it yielded a lot. I served half a portion per person and for protein, served with breaded cod. It was very good! Will make it again but for the record, I think the pasta itself alone makes for a meal!
This is a great recipe! It is super easy to make and the taste is awesome. My husband loves it! I am so glad this popped up in my email

Wow! Loved this! Borderline a TAD salty for our tastes but didn‚Äôt stop us from gobbling up!! Maybe next time skip the salt or use low sodium broth. I do think 1 c Parmesan is too much. Started with 1/4c and thought it was plenty - especially since I sprinkled with shredded Parmesan over each serving. Loved this pasta as written and would absolutely make again! Make again as is, to pair with some blackened salmon or even add some chicken or shrimp to it. No matter how you pair or add, this could be the basis for a date night meal! Thanks Celestial!!
Love this simple little recipe...
Too runny. Next time I‚Äôd use about half the chicken broth. But it tasted amazing! I even added some shrimp
Absolutely delicious. Used a large elbow style pasta and it was perfect. Added some chopped chicken. It was a huge hit with the hubby‚Ä¶
Pretty nice but too garlicky for my taste and a little too oily. I'll probably halve the garlic next time and leave out the butter.
Delicious, quick and easy !!!
It was very good. Full of favor luv this pasta dish.
So easy to make and the whole family loved it!!
It was awesome tasty ummyyüòãüòãüòã

This was a fantastic meal thrown together with what we had‚Ä¶ we were missing Parmesan so used Tex mex shredded cheese, out of parsley so used basil and it was delicious! Easy to make and we will definitely have again.

OMG this was one of the best pasta recipes I‚Äôve ever made. Made the first batch on Wednesday and we ate it up so I made another batch yesterday on Thursday. Will definitely add this to my recipes to cook list.
Yes, I added chicken to it.

I made this tonight and my husband and I both loved it!! I didn't have cream so used cream cheese and at the end I added a can of chicken but overall it was fantastic--a very forgiving recipe and obsolutely delicious!! Highly recommend and we'll be making this over and over... next time probaby a double batch!! Thank you!

This recipe is a keeper! I made this for my hubby's Happy Father's Day dinner and he loved it! I added grilled chicken breast meat and a little Trader Joe's Citrus Garlic seasoning to the liquid; otherwise I followed the recipe. I served it with a yummy Ceasar salad, a wonderful white wine, and followed it with a homemade peach cobbler pound cake for dessert. A perfect meal. Thanks for a great recipe.
Fantastic and simple to make. I had all the ingredients in the fridge. I added some red pepper flakes and baby spinach. This is a keeper!!! Creamy garlic flavor with tender pasta. Perfect!
Great meal!!!! One pot dinner, you can't beat that!!! I did use heavy whipping cream ( not heavy cream ) so I needed to thicken a bit so I added a teaspoon of cornstarch.

Very good! I accidentally cooked my noodles 1st but after about 5 minutes I was able to drain and add to the broth. Also, I had no parsley but instead used Italian seasoning and added peas. Next time I'll make exactly as written and add scallops as suggested. It was like pasta roni but 10x better of course!
Insanely easy and soo good! Best of all, 1 pot...easy clean up. I often add any leftovers like veggies, or protein I might have on hand. Great dish!
Followed the recipe but used fresh italian parsley. It was delicious.
Quick & easy, my daughter loved it!! I used 4 cups chicken broth, 1 Lb. Penne pasta, and 1 cup of half & half instead. üëå turned out wonderfully creamy & so delicious!!
Simply amazing! I have made this recipe twice now, as written. Thank you for sharing.

Followed the recipe exactly and added some seared scallops and cooked prawns. Very easy recipe for a quick yummy meal. Next time however, I would add no more than 2/3 cup of parmesan. I think that would make for a better blend of flavors.

Made this last night and it was FABULOUS!!!! Added small diced red onion, omitted the salt, used a combination of low sodium chicken broth/low sodium vegetable broth/water, used half & half, like 8 cloves of garlic (I love garlic!!!), and whole wheat pasta. It was simply delicious and wasn't missing the salt at all due to the parmesan cheese. Ate with a side of roasted broccoli and carrots. I will certainly be making the again.
Family loved it and is requesting it again.

This was awesome because it was all in one pot and no draining of pasta necessary. I doubled the chicken stock for a pound, added some saut√©ed prosciutto and asparagus that I added back when the cheese was melted into the cream.

SOOOOO GOOD!! I'm a very experienced cook & find that I usually have to considerably modify recipes I find on here--not so with this one! 

I added some shrimp that I marinated in white wine, lemon juice & garlic and cooked in butter & garnished with green onions. 

This recipe has a lot of potential for variations. Next time, I'm going to top with some roughly chopped bacon to give it carbonara-like vibes.
This recipe was sooo easy and absolutely delicious! I added peas in my pasta and it turned out perfect! Will be making this again
Loved this. I added cooked shrimp at rhe end. Will be making this one again.
this was not for me. it was way too garlicky for my taste but i would definitely love it if it had maybe half the garlic.
Loved it! I added mushrooms and green onions
I quadrupled the recipe, so we'd have leftovers. It turned out great. Light, garlicky, and flavorful.

This Creamy Garlic Pasta was better than the pastas that I had made before. It was the BEST PASTA EVER. I can't wait to make more for my family. They absolutely love it. Thank you for sharing this with us.
Delicious!!!
It turned out really delicious, even though I accidentally spilled a bit of the broth. It also was pretty easy to make.
Delicious. Easy to prepare.

This was awesome. I will use part chicken broth and part veggie broth to cut down on the sodium but the flavor is still there. I also add either spinach, broccoli or peas so we get a veggie in there too.
It‚Äôs all gone was delicious...
Used Knorr bouillon cube instead of clear broth and omitted cream. Fantastic flavor!

This was so good. I added sauteed onions, mushrooms, peas, and a chicken breast but I made the pasta dish just as written. It was delish. I will definitely be making this again and plan on using shrimp next time.
I'm 12 and this was so easy to make and it's really good.

This turned out lovely! great flavor, super easy to make. I made the recipe as written (4 servings) the only thing I'm going to do different is cut the recipe in half.! at 4 servings as a side there was enough left over to make an entire other dinner with, cut up some sausage and fried it up a little, add some peas and a little milk, mixed it all together with the pasta!
I altered it quite a bit. Added oregano and basil to season. Added green, yellow and red pepper as well as mushrooms, onion and chicken. Voila!! Amazing meal my husband now howls for.

OMG!!! This was so easy and DELICIOUS. I made it as per the recipe the first time. The 2nd time, I had some leftover chicken strips and some canned mushrooms which I decided to add. I did reheat the chicken strips in the oven after coating them with some garlic, oil and some blackened seasoning. I added the mushrooms about a minute before the pasta was done and then added the cream and cheese. I used the cut up chicken strips to top off the pasta. It was delicious either way.
Have made this several times. The whole family loves it.
Wow!!!

We enjoyed it! Although we didn‚Äôt have dried parsley, so substituted with a Italian-ish seasoning mix. Didn‚Äôt have grated Parmesan- so used the Costco blend of Parmesan Romano. We had fresh gnocchi, but it turned too mushy for our liking (cooked for 7 minutes instead of the 12 for regular pasta). I‚Äôll keep this as an easy meal favorite. On another note, we didn‚Äôt find the garlic to be overpowering (although we love garlic and added an extra clove to the recipe)

Made this tonight but added a can of drained and rinsed diced tomatoes. I also cooked some chicken bite sized dipped in eggs then breadcrumbs mixed with garlic salt and Parmesan and pan fried and added on top of the end result. Everyone loved it including the very picky 18mo old.
I will definitely be making this again!!! I am going to make it with a little less garlic and a little more cheese but overall an AMAZING recipe.
Very good recipe. Simple and easy.
so easy and simple, and surprisingly tasty!
I only had cavatappi on hand. For a full box I doubled everything and it took 6 cups of chicken broth. Delicious!!
Swapped chicken broth for vegetable broth and heavy cream changed to sour creme still turned out amazing
Great recipe! I made a few minor changes, like using veggie broth instead of chicken broth and substituting 1/4 of a pkg of cream.cheese for the cream. Then, I added shrimp scampi to it.

I doubled the recipe. I used a lg 49oz can of chicken broth, whole pint of heavy cream, 2c parm cheese, and used angel hair instead. It was very good. Next time, I would use less Parmesan cheese and maybe a a thicker pasta, like maybe linguini fini. I don‚Äôt care for spaghetti and I think fettuccine would be too thick. It was very quick and easy to make. I loved the ‚Äúone‚Äù pot recipe, not a lot of clean-up. I would make this again. Thank you
Very creamy and tasty. We added shallots in with the garlic and topped off with grilled chicken and green onions.

It was so good!! I made as directed, and it was delicious... I made it for my parents, my niece and myself, everybody loved it! I did add canned chicken, and on the side I cooked up some jalapenos and onions, that I didnt mix with the pasta. I like spice but not everybody does, so i just added the onions and jalapenos on mine. So good!! Thanks for the recipe, I will definitely make again. Maybe I'll add some mushrooms next time.
I did everything exactly except I had fusili noodles in the cupboard and a tomato that needed to be eaten so chopped it up minus the seeds and awesome
I have made this several time as written and it's perfect every single time. It's so easy to throw together on those busy work week nights. Pour a glass of red wine and enjoy.
Delicious, I added my usual onions and red, green and yellow bell peppers, sprinkle cheese on top and you're in heaven.
This is an awesome base recipe.....I added scallions, spinach and some capers due to my preference.

I doubled it so I could use a full box of pasta, the broth I brought up to four cup, or one box of stock, the other ingredients I doubled as well......turned out great. Had more stock on hand if I needed it, but this time I didn‚Äôt. Will do that again so I‚Äôll have leftovers.

This dish is always good, and today I added some chicken (from the Penne w/chicken recipe!) along with some asparagus - I steamed it; (it was frozen from Aldi's and it's always good, too). This dish is a winner no matter what you do. A nice salad, garlic bread and of course a nice glass of wine makes an awesome dinner for everyone.
Pretty easy to make and tasty! I use whole wheat pasta and add peas and shrimp. I use the whole container of chicken broth and skip the extra salt.
Excellent! Made exactly as written and wouldn't change a thing. I have never been a big fan of alfredo sauce but my husband loves it. I had seconds, which is a first for me and alfredo.
This is absolutely delicious! Used rotini pasta. Amazing!
Excellent use for leftover chicken broth.
Made exactly as submitted. I used 4 cups of broth in total. Enjoyed by the entire family with recommendations to ‚Äúmake again!‚Äù Thank you for sharing your recipe!
Added some leftover baked chicken.

It lacked flavor. I added so extra seasoning to it my daughter called it garlic bread pasta. I added probably 7 or so more seasonings and I still thought it bland. Green top onions would've been a nice addition to it.
so good. my granddaughter could not get enough of it. will make again.
Great recipe easy to make I used parmesan and a garlic herb cheese fantastic to spice it up I added caujan seasoning.

The taste is sublime, but very very rich. I added king prawns to finish and a salad on the side, which was delicious together with the pasta!
next time I will drain the remaining stock from the pasta before adding the cream and cheese, as the sauce was extremely thin and didn't stick to the pasta.

Used a full package of angel hair pasta split in half, 4 cups of broth and all other ingredients increased by about a third. The angel hair pasta took slightly less time to cook. Loved it. Will definitely do it again.
Delicious recipe! I used all four cups of chicken broth while preparing the recipe , and I added capers and grilled chicken on top before serving.
Loved it served it with chicken
Very good!
We made it with shrimp and extra garlic. Turned out fabulous.

My family‚Äôs current favorite dish I‚Äôve made. I used the entire standard chicken broth box & added some cream cheese to make it a little more creamy. Also served with precooked small shrimp. I would definitely recommend this recipe!

I doubled the recipe and used angel hair pasta for this. I also used grilled chicken and it was delicious. I was impressed that I was able to do this all in one T-Fal skillet, so it made cleanup very easy. I foresee this being at least a once a month meal in my home!

This was so easy and so good. I will definitely be making it again!! I used 1/2 and 1/2 in place of the heavy cream, otherwise, made it exactly as directed. Just trying to make it a little more healthy. Served it with grilled chicken and broccoli. Can't wait for the leftovers.
Made this receipe as is. My family loved it. This will definitely be on rotation.

Made it as written an served with some broccoli and garlic bread. My husband and I both liked it, but I think it was actually a bit too much cheese, and I LOVE cheese. I think I could leave out at least 1/4 (maybe 1/2) of the cheese next time, and it would still be good but cut down some of the calorie/fat content.
Made according to directions and it was excellent
